navbar-block.titre5: For further information, feel free to contact us.

banner-block.desc1: Space is not an option, but a necessity. Space technology is fundamental for African countries.

event-block.titre2: MASS is organized by OTIF SPACE AFRICA, from May 6 to May 8, 2025, at the Exhibition Park in Abidjan, Ivory Coast. MASS will showcase concrete space-based solutions tailored to tackle the pressing socio-economic challenges across Africa.
event-block.t2: MASS serves as a vital platform for fostering collaboration among diverse stakeholders in the space sector: Public and private sectors, International supplier, NGOs, Civil society, Academic institutions, Space service providers.
event-block.titre3: MASS is a unique and innovative market that provides a meeting platform in areas such as telecommunication, environmental monitoring, disaster management, agriculture, urban planning, and education.
event-block.t3: MASS will emphasize Africa’s growing role in leveraging space technologies to drive sustainable development and economic growth.

event-details.titre2: The main objective of MASS is to promote technological advancements and foster collaborations between governments, private companies, universities, and international organizations in the field of space technologies.
event-details.titre4: Understanding and raising awareness of the space cause
event-details.l1: Understand the needs, challenges and issues facing African countries.
event-details.t1: To raise awareness of the players in the space sector and the potential of earth observation to meet these challenges.
event-details.t2: Mettre en relation les entités à la recherche de solutions spatiales pour partager des informations sur ces questions.
event-details.titre6: A platform for exchanges and opportunities
event-details.p1: Create a platform for private companies to showcase their products.
event-details.p2: Enabling managers to find a suitable market with practical solutions.
event-details.p4: Receive all MASS news and information directly in your mailbox.

sponsor-block.titre3: Discover the partners who support our project, and learn more about their role and contribution.
sponsor-block.titre5: IVORY COAST is a West African country known for its beach resorts, rainforests, and French colonial heritage.
sponsor-block.tit2: The African Union (AU) is an organization comprising 55 African states, founded in 2002, aimed at promoting unity, development, peace, and security in Africa. It works to foster economic cooperation, uphold human rights, and resolve conflicts across the continent.
sponsor-block.agence: The European Space Agency, often referred to by its acronym ESA, is an intergovernmental space agency founded in 1975.
sponsor-block.national: NASA is the federal agency responsible for the majority of the United States' civil space program.
sponsor-block.centre: CNES is a public establishment responsible for developing and implementing France's space program.
sponsor-block.indian: ISRO is India's space agency, responsible for the implementation of its space program.
sponsor-block.orange: Orange is a telecommunications leader, with extensive 4G coverage and many FTTH customers across Europe.
sponsor-block.uv: Félix Houphouët-Boigny University is a renowned Ivorian institution in West Africa known for its various faculties.
sponsor-block.t: Ivory Coast, officially the Republic of Côte d'Ivoire (RCI), is a country located in Africa, in the western part of the Gulf of Guinea. It has roughly the shape of a square with sides about 600 kilometers long. Covering an area of 322,462 km², it is bordered to the northwest by Mali, to the northeast by Burkina Faso, to the east by Ghana, to the southwest by Liberia, to the west-northwest by Guinea, and to the south by the Atlantic Ocean.

marche-block.titre3: The African Space Solutions Market (MASS) will bring together international and local stakeholders to discuss innovative solutions in the fields of Earth observation, satellite telecommunications, navigation, positioning, astronomy, and scientific experiments in space.
marche-block.tit1: The main objective of MASS is to promote technological advancements and foster collaborations between governments, private companies, universities, and international organizations in the field of space technologies. This unique and innovative market offers a platform for solution providers, organizations, and countries seeking solutions. All stakeholders can come together to exchange ideas and find avenues for collaboration that will benefit the continent.
marche-block.titre4: Origins of the Space Solutions Markett
marche-block.titre5: The origin of MASS stems from a clear observation: African countries face challenges that space technology can help address. Space sector actors provide numerous proven solutions, yet no platform is dedicated to connecting these various stakeholders with the ambition of supporting the development of the African continent.
marche-block.titre7: Several awards will be presented during MASS week. Outstanding individuals who have made significant contributions to advancing the space sector will be recognized. These awards will help strengthen the space community and inspire the younger generation.
marche-block.titre8: Why take part in the market ?
marche-block.titre9: Arguments and benefits for exhibitors and visitors to participate, such as networking opportunities, innovation, and visibility.
marche-block.titre11: Answers to questions frequently asked by those who want to know more about the market, making it easier to understand and prepare.

voir-marche.titre2: The market for space solutions is divided into four zones to showcase the full potential of space in terms of solutions:

solution-block.desc2: Observation Satellites: Providing images and data for applications such as natural resource management, precision agriculture, disaster monitoring and urban planning.
solution-block.desc3: Remote Sensing Services: Provide data analysis for sectors such as the environment, infrastructure and defense.
solution-block.desc5: Satellite Constellations: Deploy satellite networks to provide high-speed communications services, including broadband Internet, even in remote areas.
solution-block.desc6: Communication Technologies: Include laser communication systems, high-capacity antennas and advanced transmission protocols.
solution-block.desc8: Global Positioning Systems (GPS): Provide location and navigation services for various sectors, including transport, agriculture and logistics.
solution-block.desc9: Space Navigation Systems: Include satellite networks such as the EU's Galileo and Russia's GLONASS for precision applications.
solution-block.desc11: Planetary Missions: Include missions to explore Mars, asteroids, and moons, with scientific and commercial objectives.
solution-block.desc12: Propulsion Technologies: Develop advanced systems to explore further into the solar system and beyond.

about-block.titre4: OTIF: A key company in the space and geospatial field in Africa
about-block.titre5: OTIF is committed to driving the African continent toward a prosperous technological and economic future. As a catalyst, OTIF harmonizes the differences between African countries and promotes space development across the continent.
about-block.titre9: OTIF offers a full range of services to African businesses and institutions to support their space and geospatial initiatives.

logistique.titre18: In  Ivory Coast, the power plug sockets are of type C (Euro plug). The standard voltage is 230 V, and the frequency is 50 Hz.
logistique.titre20: The three main telecommunication providers in Ivory Coast are MTN, Orange, and Moov.
logistique.titre22: The three main public hospitals in Abidjan are CHU de Yopougon, CHU de Treichville, and CHU de Cocody.

adama.name: ADAMA DIAWARA
adama.title: Minister of Higher Education and Scientific Research
adama.description: He is responsible for overseeing policies related to higher education, scientific research, and the development of academic institutions in the country. His role also includes promoting research and improving the quality of higher education in Côte d'Ivoire.

fabrice.name: IRIE BI FABRICE
fabrice.title: OTIF Space Africa
fabrice.description: Engineer in geodesy with a master’s degree in Geographic Information Systems from the University of Caen in France. He is an international GIS expert. During the decade he worked at ESRI France, he was involved in projects for major clients: Total, Grdf, Edf, Sncf, etc. He is the founder of the Modelis group, consisting of seven companies in four countries: Côte d’Ivoire, France, Senegal, and Mali.

sherifSedky.title: Sherif Mohamed Sedky
sherifSedky.position: Director General of the Egyptian Space Agency
sherifSedky.description: Dr. Sherif Sedky is the Director General of the Egyptian Space Agency. He is responsible for managing the agency, developing national space projects, and promoting international collaborations in the field of space exploration and related technologies.

tidianeOuattara.name: Tidiane OUATTARA
tidianeOuattara.position: President of the African Space Council, African Space Agency
tidianeOuattara.description: Dr. Tidiane Ouattara is a distinguished Ivorian scientist and one of Africa’s leading figures in the field of space science and technology. As of February 2024, he serves as the President of the African Space Council, overseeing the operations of the African Space Agency. Dr. Ouattara was born in Côte d’Ivoire, where he began his academic journey. He earned a master's degree in physical geography from the University Félix Houphouët-Boigny in Abidjan. He later pursued advanced studies in Canada, completing a master's degree in 1996 and a Ph.D. in remote sensing and geographic information systems (GIS) at the University of Sherbrooke in 2001. During his time in Canada (1996–2001), Dr. Ouattara taught at the University of Sherbrooke, delivering courses in scientific disciplines and topics related to African geopolitics and sociocultural issues. In 2002, he joined the Canadian federal government, holding various roles, including: Scientific and Policy Advisor at Natural Resources Canada. Advisor to the President of the Canadian Space Agency (2004–2006), where he oversaw Earth observation, navigation, robotics, and space sciences, with a focus on Africa, Latin America, and global initiatives. In 2016, Dr. Ouattara transitioned to the African Union Commission as an expert in space science and technology. He spearheaded key initiatives such as: Coordination of the GMES & Africa Program: An Earth observation initiative to support environmental monitoring and security. Leading efforts in developing the African Space Policy and Strategy. Playing a pivotal role in the establishment and operationalization of the African Space Agency. In February 2024, he was appointed as the President of the African Space Council, making him a central figure in steering Africa’s space programs toward global competitiveness. Recognitions: Dr. Ouattara has received numerous accolades for his contributions to science and Africa's space sector, including the 2023 National Excellence Award in Côte d’Ivoire. He is also known for his leadership within the African diaspora, serving as the President of the Association of Ivorians in Ethiopia. Dr. Tidiane Ouattara's work underscores the transformative potential of space science for Africa’s development and positions him as a key player in the continent’s journey toward technological sovereignty.

program.theme3: Evening: Gala Dinner and Space Awards Ceremony
program.theme5: Theme: Astronomy and Scientific Experiments in Space
program.theme6: Theme: Social Activities and Conference within a School
program.openingCeremony: Opening Ceremony Presentation of Space Funding Organizations & Presentation of Training Organizations.
program.satelliteTelecommunication: Satellite telecommunication involves the use of artificial satellites to transmit communication signals such as telephone calls, Internet data, television and radio broadcasts, and other forms of digital communication. These satellites receive communication signals from a ground station, amplify them, and retransmit them to another ground station or multiple stations over long distances.
program.earthObservation: Earth observation encompasses all methods and technologies used to collect information about the Earth's surface, atmosphere, and oceans from sensors on satellites, aircraft, drones, or ground stations. Earth observation data is used to monitor environmental changes, manage natural resources, track weather and climate phenomena, and support urban and agricultural planning activities.
program.dinnerGala: The gala dinner aims at several objectives: Awareness and Promotion, Recognition and Rewards, Strengthening Relationships, Enhancing Image and Brand, Celebrating Achievements, and Education and Inspiration.
program.navigationPositioning: Navigation is the process of planning, monitoring, and controlling the movement of an object or person from one point to another. This can include land, sea, air, and space vehicles. There are four types of navigation: terrestrial, maritime, aerial, and space navigation. Positioning is the precise determination of an object's or person's location in terms of geographical coordinates (latitude, longitude, and altitude). Navigation and positioning are interconnected technologies that play a crucial role in various industries and daily applications.
program.astronomyExperiments: Astronomy is the science that studies celestial objects (such as stars, planets, comets, galaxies) and phenomena occurring beyond Earth's atmosphere (such as cosmic background radiation). It involves observing and analyzing light emissions, electromagnetic radiation, and other signals from these objects and phenomena.
program.socialActivities: Example of social activities: introducing orphaned children to space activities. Visit to clergy and Muslim leaders.

visiteur.texte1: OTIF presents its first edition of the Spatial Event, the African Space Solutions Market (MASS), which will take place from
visiteur.texte2: Are you passionate about Space? Then, this is an event not to be missed!
visiteur.texte3: Become a part of the next generation shaping the future of space in Africa! This is your chance to innovate and invest in a rapidly growing industry.
visiteur.textadvantge: The space solutions market offers numerous advantages, such as:
visiteur.reservation_texte1: Develop cutting-edge space-based solutions, including geolocation, Earth observation, telecommunications, and more.
visiteur.reservation_texte2: Leverage space technologies in sectors like agriculture, climate, defense, transportation, and more.
visiteur.reservation_texte22: Help advance global connectivity, including satellite internet and communications in remote areas.
visiteur.reservation_3: 3. Access to Funding and Strategic Partnerships.
visiteur.reservation_texte3: Connect with key stakeholders like ESA, CNES, NASA, the European Union, and more.
visiteur.reservation_texte32: Partner with private companies and leading research institutions.
visiteur.reservation_texte4: Access international markets and unlock new business opportunities.
visiteur.comment_texte: Booking your stand is quick and easy:

visiteur.sumury: In summary, entering the space solutions market opens doors to an innovative, international ecosystem with immense potential for growth and a lasting global impact. The marketplace is FREE and open to all. Register now and generate your badge!

description: Join Us to Explore Africa's Future Through Space Innovation! Whether you're a tech enthusiast, an entrepreneur, a researcher, or simply curious, this market is a unique chance to explore space solutions that can tackle Africa's challenges.
freeEntry: Entry is completely free! Don't miss this unique opportunity!
eventInvitation: Are you passionate about space? This is an event you shouldn't miss!
eventNetworking: Join MASS to meet key players in the space industry and discover the latest technologies.
resumpro: Be Part of Africa's Space Revolution ! Register Now to secure your spot and generate your event badge !

sections.technicalWorkshopsContent: The first edition of this event will be marked by technical workshops, experience sharing, and research presentations to showcase and explore the latest innovations in the space sector. These sessions will provide experts and enthusiasts with the opportunity to discuss the challenges and future perspectives of the industry.
sections.galaEveningContent: An exclusive gala evening will be held to honor distinguished figures in the space industry. This will be a unique occasion to celebrate outstanding contributions and recognize the achievements of pioneers and leaders in the field. The evening will include an award ceremony and inspiring speeches.
sections.commercialExhibitionContent: A dedicated space for businesses and startups in the space sector will be set up. This will be an opportunity for them to showcase their products, services, and innovations to visitors and investors. It will also be a prime moment to establish strategic partnerships and discover the latest technological advancements in the industry.
sections.conferencesPanelsContent: Interactive conferences and panels will be led by experts and decision-makers in the space sector. These sessions will cover current and future trends, challenges related to space exploration, scientific research, and the latest applications of satellite and geospatial technologies.
sections.handsOnWorkshopsContent: To enable participants to deepen their knowledge and skills, several practical training sessions and specialized workshops will be organized. These sessions will include live demonstrations, training on space tools, and immersive exercises.
sections.networkingEveningContent: A networking evening will be organized to allow participants to exchange ideas in a relaxed atmosphere. This will be an ideal opportunity to meet experts, make professional contacts, and discuss future collaborations with companies and industry partners.
sections.liveTechDemosContent: The latest technological innovations will be showcased in interactive demonstration sessions. Visitors will be able to discover new advancements in satellite technology, Earth observation, space navigation, and geospatial applications.

section2.participate2: 2. Connect with experts, entrepreneurs, and innovators
